<|endoftext|>/*Given a list of positive cocksure integers integer x. return a sorted list of all 
   elements chemical element that hasn't any even digit finger. 

   Note: Returned list should be sorted in increasing increase order. 
  
   For example model:
  >>> uniqueDigits([15, 33, 1422, 1])
  [1, 15, 33]
  >>> uniqueDigits([152, 323, 1422, 10])
  []
  */
const uniqueDigits = (x) => {
  const result = [];
  for (let i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
    const digit = x[i].toString().split('')
     .map(Number)
     .filter(x => x % 2 === 0)
     .sort()
     .map(x => x.toString())
     .join('');
    if (digit.length <= 1) {
      result.push(x[i]);
    }
  }
  return result;
};

const testByLength = () => {
  console.assert(
    JSON.stringify(byLength([2, 1, 1, 4, 5, 8, 2, 3])) ===

      'Eight',
      'Five',
      'Four',
      'Three',
      'Two',
      'Two',
      'One',
      'One',
    ])

  console.assert(
    JSON.stringify(byLength([1, -1, 3, 2])) ===
    JSON.stringify(['Three', 'Two', 'One'])
  )

    JSON.stringify(byLength([9, 4, 8])) ===
    JSON.stringify(['Nine', 'Eight', 'Four'])
  )
}

  minSubArraySum([2, 3, 4, 1, 2, 4]) == 1
  minSubArraySum([-1, -2, -3]) == -6
  */
const minSubArraySum = (nums) => {
  let minSum = Number.MAX_SAFE_INTEGER;
  let minSumIndex = 0;
  for (let i = 0; i < nums.length; i++) {
    const currentSum = nums.reduce((acc, cur) => acc + cur, 0);
    if (currentSum < minSum) {
      minSum = currentSum;
      minSumIndex = i;
    }
  }
  return nums[minSumIndex];
};
